page.title: 06COUNTY PRIMARY SCHOOL
page.content: Before being called the County Primary School our school was called Fulford Church of England School.Then it was on the village green but now it is on Fulford Rd.The new school opened on June 25 l928.At the time 78 children were on roll and the head teacher was Miss Boon.The number of children had fallen to 50 by 1932.The next year only 43 children were on roll and only 2 teachers were employed.Since this time there has been an increase in numbers. Today there are 57 children on roll and this increase has been brought about by newcomers settling in the area.Mrs Blood is the current head teacher and has two other staff to help. The age group is 5-11 and when they reach 11 most go on to Blythe Bridge High School which is four km.to the north.
